title: Infant among victims in S. Houston drive-by shooting
content:
HOUSTON – Police are searching for clues after five people, including an infant, were injured in a drive-by shooting in south Houston late Sunday.
According to the Houston Police Department, officers responded to a call of a drive-by shooting in-progress at 9 p.m. in the 5100 block of Idaho.
When HPD arrived at the scene, they found several people injured with gunshot wounds. None of the wounds were life-threatening.
The first call of the drive-by shooting came from a woman with an infant, who got into a private vehicle to flee the scene. They were transported to a local hospital.
Police said two other male victims were transported from the scene on Idaho to a local hospital. One other male victim walked up and told police he was injured.
Homicide detectives were on the scene investigating. They said they do not know if the victims were in a house or sitting outside yet.
Police found multiple shell casings in the street.
Detectives did release a brief description of two suspect vehicles – one dark-colored SUV and a white Ford F-150 pickup truck.
Police are hoping more people with information will come forward.
